animals.animalDescription: Known as the King of the Jungle, lions live in prides and are found in savannas and grasslands. Male lions have majestic manes.
The largest wild cats, tigers are solitary hunters with iconic orange and black stripes. They live in forests and grasslands.
Native to China, these gentle bears are famous for their black-and-white fur and bamboo diet.
Marsupials found in Australia, koalas sleep for up to 20 hours a day and feed on eucalyptus leaves.
Gentle primates living in forests, gorillas are known for their intelligence, strength, and close-knit family groups.
These powerful swimmers live in the Arctic and depend on sea ice to hunt seals.
Tree-dwelling apes found in Borneo and Sumatra, known for their reddish fur and high intelligence.
A rare color variant of Bengal tigers, white tigers have blue eyes and white fur with black stripes.
African animals with distinctive black-and-white stripes. Each zebra's pattern is unique.
Marsupials native to Australia, kangaroos hop on powerful hind legs and carry their young in pouches.
Long-legged wading birds often associated with wetlands and rivers.
ropical birds with large, curved beaks often found in rainforests.
